|Title=Knowing the definition of pulmonary hypertension (PH) in adults
|Description=None
|Topic=Definition
|Contributors=
|Order=3}}
Pulmonary hypertension (PH) is defined as mean pulmonary arterial pressure >20 mmHg and resistance >3 UW measured during right heart catheterisation. When it is secondary to CKD, it is classified in group 3 of PH. It is suspected on cardiac ultrasound by assessment of systolic blood pressure (SBP >35mmHg). Confirmation by right heart catheterisation is rarely indicated in cases of documented CKD.

properties.question: What is the definition of pulmonary hypertension (PH) in adults according to the provided information?
properties.option_a: Mean pulmonary arterial pressure >20 mmHg and resistance >3 UW measured during right heart catheterization
properties.option_b: Mean pulmonary arterial pressure <20 mmHg and resistance <3 UW measured during right heart catheterization
properties.option_c: Systolic blood pressure (SBP) >35mmHg on cardiac ultrasound without right heart catheterization
properties.option_d: Chronic kidney disease (CKD) diagnosis based on blood tests
